info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:46PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT, SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 345 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arch, or 17 miles southeast of Portales, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Dora, Grady, Ranchvale, Arch, Oasis State Park, Cannon Air Force Base and Pep. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 374 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.
